p: Recently, it was reported that emodin isolated from the roots of Rheum tanguticum possess remarkable antiviral activity against HSV infection in vitro and in vivo (Xiong et al. 2011), and thus emodin is a promising agent in the clinical therapy of HSV infection. Besides, seven new homoflavonoid glucosides, pedunculosumosides A–G were isolated from the whole plant of Ophioglossum pedunculosum, pedunculosumosides A and C exhibit modest activity of blocking HBsAg secretion with IC 50 values of 238.0 and 70.5 μM, respectively (Wan et al. 2011).
